item.title: jannat add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "When I dare to be powerful, to use my strength in the service of my vision, then it becomes less and less important whether I am afraid." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: jannat add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "Your silence will not protect you." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: jannat add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "If I didn't define myself for myself, I would be crunched into other people's fantasies for me and eaten alive." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: jannat add a quote by Nalo Hopkinson
item.description: "My friend Ian Hagemann, a regular at Wiscon, once said on a panel that when he reads science fiction futures that are full of white people and no one else, he wonders when the race war happened that wiped out the majority of the human race, and why the writer hasn’t mentioned such an important plot point." -- Nalo Hopkinson

item.title: jannat add a quote by Rebecca Walker
item.description: "It seems to me, that this, too, is how memory works. What we remember of what was done to us shapes our view, molds us, sets our stance. But what we remember is past, it no longer exists, and yet we hold on to it, live by it, surrender so much control to it. What do we become when we put down the scripts written by history and memory, when each person before us can be seen free of the cultural or personal narrative we've inherited or devised? When we, ourselves, can taste that freedom." -- Rebecca Walker

item.title: jannat add a quote by Rebecca Walker
item.description: ". . . when it comes down to it, that’s what life is all about: showing up for the people you love, again and again, until you can’t show up anymore." -- Rebecca Walker

item.title: jannat add a quote by Rebecca Walker
item.description: "Sex can look like love if you don't know what love looks like." -- Rebecca Walker

item.title: jannat add a quote by Steven Barnes
item.description: "in life every thing comes with a price even freedom" -- Steven Barnes

item.title: jannat add a quote by Nnedi Okorafor
item.description: "Funny how all things people don’t understand seem to be ‘cursed’." -- Nnedi Okorafor

item.title: jannat add a quote by Nnedi Okorafor
item.description: "Flawed, imperfect creatures! That's what we both are, oga! That's what we ALL are!" -- Nnedi Okorafor

item.title: jannat add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "i found god in myself and i loved her i loved her fiercely" -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: jannat add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "one thing I don’t need is any more apologies i got sorry greetin me at my front door you can keep yrs i don’t know what to do wit em they don’t open doors or bring the sun back they don’t make me happy or get a mornin paper didn’t nobody stop usin my tears to wash cars cuz a sorry." -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: jannat add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description:
"without any assistance or guidance from you i have loved you assiduously for 8 months 2 wks & a day i have been stood up four times i've left 7 packages on yr doorstep forty poems 2 plants & 3 handmade notecards i left town so i cd send to you have been no help to me on my job you call at 3:00 in the mornin on weekdays so i cd drive 27 1/2 miles cross the bay before i go to work charmin charmin but you are of no assistance i want you to know this waz an experiment to see how selifsh i cd be if i wd really carry on to snare a possible lover if i waz capable of debasin my self for the love of another if i cd stand not being wanted when i wanted to be wanted & i cannot so with no further assistance & no guidance from you i am endin this affair
this note is attached to a plant i've been waterin since the day i met you you may water it yr damn self" -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: jannat add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "Through my tears I found god in myself and I loved her fiercely" -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: jannat add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "Ever since I realized there waz someone callt/ a colored girl an evil woman a bitch or a nag/ i been tryin not to be that & leave bitterness/ in somebody else's cup..." -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: jannat add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "i usedta live in the world really be in the world free & sweet talkin good mornin & thank-you & nice day uh huh i cant now i cant be nice to nobody nice is such a rip-off regular beauty & a smile in the street is just a set-up" -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: jannat add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "somebody/ anybody sing a black girl's song bring her out to know herself to know you but sing her rhythms carin/ struggle/ hard times sing her song of life she's been dead so long closed in silence so long she doesn't know the sound of her own voice her infinite beauty she's half-notes scattered without rhythm/ no tune sing her sighs sing the song of her possibilities sing a righteous gospel let her be born let her be born & handled warmly." -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: jannat add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "Where there is a woman there is magic." -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: jannat add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "And this is for Colored girls who have considered suicide, but are moving to the ends of their own rainbows." -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: jannat add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "Where there is a woman there is magic. If there is a moon falling from her mouth, she is a woman who knows her magic, who can share or not share her powers. A woman with a moon falling from her mouth, roses between her legs and tiaras of Spanish moss, this woman is a consort of the spirits." -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: jannat add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "my spirit is too ancient to understand the separation of soul & gender" -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: jannat add a quote by June Jordan
item.description: "I am not wrong: Wrong is not my name My name is my own my own my own and I can’t tell you who the hell set things up like this but I can tell you that from now on my resistance my simple and daily and nightly self-determination may very well cost you your life" -- June Jordan

item.title: jannat add a quote by June Jordan
item.description:
"And who will join this standing up and the ones who stood without sweet company will sing and sing back into the mountains and if necessary even under the sea:
we are the ones we have been waiting for." -- June Jordan

item.title: jannat add a quote by June Jordan
item.description:
"and if i if i ever let love go because the hatred and the whisperings become a phantom dictate i o- bey in lieu of impulse and realities (the blossoming flamingos of my wild mimosa trees) then let love freeze me out.
(from i must become a menace to my enemies)" -- June Jordan

item.title: jannat add a quote by June Jordan
item.description: "We are the ones we have been waiting for." -- June Jordan

item.title: jannat add a quote by June Jordan
item.description: "If you are free, you are not predicatable and you are not controllable." -- June Jordan

item.title: jannat add a quote by June Jordan
item.description: "Like running trying to live a good life has to hurt a little bit, or we're not running hard enough, not really trying." -- June Jordan

item.title: jannat add a quote by June Jordan
item.description: "My heart is not peripheral to me." -- June Jordan

item.title: jannat add a quote by June Jordan
item.description: "When we heard about the hippies, the barely more than boys and girls who decided to try something different ... we laughed at them. We condemned them, our children, for seeking a different future. We hated them for their flowers, for their love, and for their unmistakable rejection of every hideous, mistaken compromise that we had made throughout our hollow, money-bitten, frightened, adult lives" -- June Jordan

item.title: jannat add a quote by June Jordan
item.description: "To begin is no more agony than opening your hand." -- June Jordan
